TowerDefense

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • TowerDefense.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    The Grid is a 2-dimensional grid of Tiles. Tiles are like little squares of land. Towers can be placed on it, and a Path can be created on it. This class is not as robust as it could be, but the foundation is solid. :)
    Author:
    Branden Drake, Rachel Horton

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Deconstructor. Destroy this Grid and all of its Tiles. Please stop using this Grid after you call this method.

      • setDimensions

        public boolean setDimensions(int columns,
                             int rows)
        Sets the dimensions of the game grid. Note that this will overwrite any existing game grid, including destroying all of the things on it.
        Parameters:

        rows -

      • setBackgroundImage

        public void setBackgroundImage(java.lang.String filename)
        Set a background image to appear on the grid. Note that by default the background is invisible.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the image file.

      • setBackgroundVisibilityTo

        public void setBackgroundVisibilityTo(boolean isVisible)
        Set whether the grid's background is visible.
        Parameters:
        isVisible - True if background should be visible

      • setPathTileVisibilityTo

        public void setPathTileVisibilityTo(boolean isVisible)
        Set whether Tiles with paths in the grid are visible. Note that Tiles without paths are never drawn, because it ends up being really expensive.
        Parameters:
        isVisible - True if Path Tiles should be visible.

      • setDrawingLayer

        public void setDrawingLayer(Engine.DrawingLayer drawingLayer)
        Puts all existing and future Tiles on the specified DrawingLayer.
        Parameters:
        drawingLayer - The DrawingLayer to draw Tiles and/or the background on.

      • update

        public void update(Engine.MouseInput mouse)
        For now this just updates each tile, including finding out if any Tiles have been clicked.

      • constructPath

        public boolean constructPath(int startColumn,
                             int startRow,
                             int endColumn,
                             int endRow)
        Constructs a Path for this Grid object. The Path is constructed by starting at the specified end Tile and connecting to an adjacent Tile that has been marked as part of the path, then connecting to the next, etc, until the start Tile has been reached. If the start and end Tiles can't be connected, or if the start or end Tiles could connect to multiple Tiles, the building of the Path will fail.
        Parameters:
        startColumn - The column of the Tile where the Path begins.
        startRow - The row of the Tile where the Path begins.
        endColumn - The column of the Tile where the Path ends.
        endRow - The row of the Tile where the Path ends.
        Returns:
        True if the Path was successfully created.

      • getPath

        public final Path getPath()
        Returns:
        A reference to this Grid's Path object.

      • containsTile

        public boolean containsTile(int column,
                            int row)
        Parameters:
        column - Column to check.
        row - Row to check.
        Returns:
        True if such a Tile exists on the Grid

      • addPathUpDown

        public boolean addPathUpDown(int column,
                             int row)
        Marks the corresponding Tile as being a part of the Path, with the ability to connect to Tiles to the top and bottom. This means that when the Path is created using constructPath(), this Tile can be included in the Path.
        Parameters:
        column - Column of the Tile to include in the Path
        row - Row of the Tile to include in the Path
        Returns:
        True if Tile was successfully marked

      • addPathLeftRight

        public boolean addPathLeftRight(int column,
                                int row)
        Marks the corresponding Tile as being a part of the Path, with the ability to connect to Tiles to the left and right. This means that when the Path is created using constructPath(), this Tile can be included in the Path.
        Parameters:
        column - Column of the Tile to include in the Path
        row - Row of the Tile to include in the Path
        Returns:
        True if Tile was successfully marked

      • addPathUpLeft

      • removePath

        public void removePath(int column,
                       int row)
        Removes a path, if any, from a Tile..
        Parameters:
        column - Column of the Tile on the Grid's grid.
        row - Row of the Tile on the Grid's grid.

      • setTileBlockedTo

        public void setTileBlockedTo(int column,
                             int row,
                             boolean isBlocked)
        Sets whether Towers are allowed to move to the specified Tile. Does not have any effect on Towers that are already occupying the Tile.
        Parameters:
        column - The column of the Tile
        row - The row of the Tile
        isBlocked - True if the Tile is blocked.

      • tileIsBlocked

        public boolean tileIsBlocked(int column,
                             int row)
        Returns whether or not Towers are allowed to move to the Tile. Note that this does not take into account whether the Tile is already occupied.
        Parameters:
        column - The column of the Tile
        row - The row of the Tile
        Returns:
        True if the Tile is blocked.

      • getNumberOfRows

        public int getNumberOfRows()
        Returns:
        The number of rows in the current Grid

      • getNumberOfColumns

        public int getNumberOfColumns()
        Returns:
        The number of columns in the current grid

      • getClickedTile

        public Tile getClickedTile()
        If a Tile was clicked by the user since the last update, returns that Tile. Otherwise, null.
        Returns:
        The clicked Tile, or null.

      • getTileWidth

        public float getTileWidth()
        Returns:
        Current width of each Tile

      • getTileHeight

        public float getTileHeight()
        Returns:
        Current height of each Tile

      • getNumberOfTilesInPath

        public int getNumberOfTilesInPath()
        Returns:
        Number of tiles in this Grid's Path.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int column,
                    int row)
        Parameters:
        column - Column of the tile (zero-indexed)
        row - Row of the tile (zero-indexed)
        Returns:
        The Tile at that location, or null.
